intro: Hieracium guentheri-beckii subsp. guentheri-beckii, commonly known as the Guenther's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers in a single terminal head. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. The species is notable for its small size and distinctive leaf morphology, which aid in its identification.
